post.description:
Upload multiple files in a single batch request for efficient document ingestion.
    
**Limits:**
- Maximum 100 files per batch
- Maximum 10MB per file
- Only text-based files are accepted (txt, md, html, json)

**Processing:**
- Files are processed concurrently (3 at a time)
- Each file is checked for duplicates independently
- Binary files are rejected with an error

**Response:**
- Returns a summary with counts and individual results for each file
- Files can have status: 'success', 'duplicate', or 'failed'
- Failed files include an error message explaining the failure

requestBody.description: Upload multiple files for batch ingestion (max 100 files)

files.description: Array of files to upload (max 100 files, 10MB each)

projectId.description: Project UUID that all documents belong to (required)

orgId.description: Optional organisation UUID to associate documents with

200.description: Batch upload completed with summary and individual results

post.summary: Search graph objects with optional neighbor expansion
post.description:
Performs semantic search over graph objects and optionally retrieves their neighbors.

**Search Strategy:**
- Uses full-text search (FTS) to find primary results matching the query
- Optionally expands each result to include:
  1. Semantically similar objects (via vector embeddings)
  2. Directly connected objects (via relationships)

**Use Cases:**
- Chat context retrieval (similar to document citations)
- Discovery features ("related objects")
- Rich detail views with context

**Neighbor Sources:**
- **Semantic**: Objects with similar embedding vectors (via searchSimilar)
- **Relational**: Objects connected via graph relationships (depends_on, implements, etc.)

**Example:**
```json
{
  "query": "authentication patterns",
  "limit": 5,
  "includeNeighbors": true,
  "maxNeighbors": 3,
  "maxDistance": 0.5
}
```

neighbors.description: Map of object ID to array of neighbor objects

post.description: Enumerate divergent canonical graph objects between source and target branches. Default is dry-run (no mutations). If `execute=true` and there are no conflicts: Added objects are cloned into target; Fast-forward objects are patched by adding only new properties (superset heuristic). Conflicts block apply. Classification statuses: added, unchanged, fast_forward, conflict.

post.description:
Model Context Protocol (MCP) server endpoint.

**Protocol:** JSON-RPC 2.0
**Methods:** initialize, tools/list, tools/call
**Tools:** schema_version, schema_changelog, type_info, list_entity_types, query_entities

**Project Context:**
Project-specific tools (list_entity_types, query_entities) require a project ID.
You can provide it either:
1. In the initialize params: `"project_id": "uuid"`
2. Via X-Project-Id header

**Example Initialize Request (with project):**
```json
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 1,
  "method": "initialize",
  "params": {
    "protocolVersion": "2025-06-18",
    "capabilities": {},
    "clientInfo": {
      "name": "example-client",
      "version": "1.0.0"
    },
    "project_id": "1e37ab78-f4af-4e61-9b71-5e263139525b"
  }
}
```

**Example tools/list Request:**
```json
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 2,
  "method": "tools/list"
}
```

**Example tools/call Request:**
```json
{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "id": 3,
  "method": "tools/call",
  "params": {
    "name": "schema_version",
    "arguments": {}
  }
}
```

info.title: Spec Server API
info.description: Generated OpenAPI spec (code-first). All protected operations include x-required-scopes and 403 examples with missing_scopes.

subjectId.description: Canonical internal user id (subject id, from identity provider) - DEPRECATED: use id

displayName.description: Display name fallback (explicit) or derived (first + last)

phoneE164.description: E.164 formatted phone number, leading + and digits

avatarObjectKey.description: Object storage key for avatar (if stored internally)

deletedOrgs.description: IDs of organizations that were soft-deleted

deletedProjects.description: IDs of projects that were soft-deleted

processed.description: Total users processed since worker start

succeeded.description: Total successful syncs since worker start

failed.description: Total failed syncs since worker start

running.description: Whether the worker is currently running

error.description: Error message if user not found

hasEmail.description: Whether user has email in local DB

total.description: Total count of users needing sync

chat_prompt_template.description: Custom chat prompt template with placeholders

auto_extract_objects.description: When true, automatically create extraction jobs when documents are uploaded

chunking_config.description: Default document chunking configuration for this project. Used when ingesting documents without explicit chunking options. Aligned with LLM extraction batch size (1:4 ratio).

allow_parallel_extraction.description: When true, allows multiple extraction jobs to run in parallel for this project. When false (default), jobs are queued and run one at a time.

extraction_config.description: LLM extraction configuration for this project. Controls chunk size, extraction method, and timeouts.

orgId.description: Organization UUID (must belong to caller; no implicit default org)

kb_purpose.example: This knowledge base contains documentation about...
kb_purpose.description: Markdown description of the knowledge base purpose and domain. Used by auto-discovery to understand context.

chat_prompt_template.description: Custom chat prompt template. Supports placeholders: {{SYSTEM_PROMPT}}, {{MCP_CONTEXT}}, {{GRAPH_CONTEXT}}, {{MESSAGE}}, {{MARKDOWN_RULES}}

auto_extract_objects.description: Enable/disable automatic extraction of objects from uploaded documents

auto_extract_config.description: Configuration for automatic extraction (enabled_types, min_confidence, require_review, notify_on_complete, notification_channels)

chunking_config.description: Default document chunking configuration. Strategy options: character (fixed boundaries), sentence (preserves sentences), paragraph (preserves paragraphs/sections). Chunk sizes should align with LLM extraction batch size (1:4 ratio).

allow_parallel_extraction.description: When true, allows multiple extraction jobs to run in parallel for this project. When false (default), jobs are queued and run one at a time.

extraction_config.description: LLM extraction configuration. Controls chunk size (5000-100000 chars), extraction method (function_calling or responseSchema), and per-call timeout (60-600 seconds).

joinedAt.description: Date when user joined the project

status.description: Status: pending, accepted, declined, revoked, expired

pathSummary.example: Related: links to Requirement "REQ-1" via 'implements'; linked from Meeting "M3" via 'discussed_in'
pathSummary.description: Human-readable summary of how this result relates to other objects in the knowledge graph

warning.example: Embeddings unavailable; fell back to lexical.

result_count.description: Total number of results found before pagination/limits

content.description: The full text content of the document

contentLength.description: The byte length of the content field

chunks.description: Number of chunks associated with this document

totalChars.description: Total character count of all chunks in this document

embeddedChunks.description: Number of chunks that have embeddings generated

parentDocumentId.description: Parent document ID for hierarchical structures (e.g., ClickUp page hierarchy)

integrationMetadata.description: Integration-specific metadata (ClickUp IDs, creator info, etc.)

extractionStatus.description: Status of the most recent extraction job for this document (pending, running, completed, failed)

extractionCompletedAt.description: Timestamp when the most recent extraction job was completed

extractionObjectsCount.description: Number of objects extracted in the most recent extraction job

impact.description: Impact summary of entities that will be deleted

ids.description: Array of document IDs to delete

totalDocuments.description: Total number of documents to be deleted

impact.description: Aggregated impact summary across all documents

notFound.description: Document IDs that could not be found or deleted

documentTitle.description: Best-effort document title derived from filename or source URL

index.description: Zero-based index of chunk inside the document

hasEmbedding.description: Whether an embedding vector exists for this chunk

text.description: Plaintext content of the chunk (may be truncated client-side)

totalChars.description: Total characters across all chunks in document

chunkCount.description: Total number of chunks in document

embeddedChunks.description: Number of embedded chunks in document

minChunkSize.description: Minimum characters per chunk to prevent tiny chunks (default: 100)

filename.description: Original filename (optional, will fallback to uploaded file name)

orgId.description: Optional organisation UUID to associate the document with

projectId.description: Project UUID that this document belongs to (required)

chunkingStrategy.description: Chunking strategy for splitting text into chunks. Options: character (default), sentence, paragraph

chunkingOptions.description: Configuration options for the chunking strategy

orgId.description: Optional organisation UUID to associate the document with

projectId.description: Project UUID that this document belongs to (required)

chunkingStrategy.description: Chunking strategy for splitting text into chunks. Options: character (default), sentence, paragraph

chunkingOptions.description: Configuration options for the chunking strategy

subject_id.description: User subject ID (canonical internal user ID)
User subject ID (canonical internal user ID)

ids.description: Array of object IDs to update

next_cursor.description: Present when more pages available; pass as cursor query param
Present when more pages available; pass as cursor query param

relationshipTypes.description: Relationship types to follow in this phase. If omitted, all types are allowed.

direction.description: Edge traversal direction: out (src->dst), in (dst<-src), or both

maxDepth.description: Maximum depth (hops) to traverse in this phase, relative to phase start nodes

objectTypes.description: Filter discovered nodes by object types. Only matching types included.

labels.description: Filter discovered nodes by labels. Nodes must have at least one matching label.

asOf.description: Timestamp for point-in-time query (ISO 8601 format). Only nodes/edges valid at this timestamp are included.

field.description: Which temporal field to use for filtering. Default: valid_from

edgePhases.description: Define multiple sequential traversal phases with different constraints per phase. When provided, legacy direction/max_depth/relationship_types are ignored.

nodeFilter.description: Filter nodes by property values using JSON Pointer paths and comparison operators. Only nodes satisfying the predicate are included.

edgeFilter.description: Filter edges by property values. Only edges satisfying the predicate will be traversed.

returnPaths.description: When true, include full paths from root nodes to each result node. Each path is an array of node IDs showing the traversal route.

maxPathsPerNode.description: Maximum paths to track per node (used with returnPaths). Limits memory usage when a node is reachable via many routes.

temporalFilter.description: Filter nodes and edges based on temporal validity. Enables point-in-time queries to see historical graph state.

fieldStrategy.description: Field pruning strategy to control response payload size. compact removes paths/phaseIndex (~25% reduction), minimal keeps only essential fields (~45% reduction).

minScore.description: Optional max distance (cosine) filter (0  d  2; typical cosine range).

maxDistance.description: Alias for minScore (preferred). Same constraints (0  d  2). If both provided, maxDistance wins.

labelsAll.description: Require all labels (array contains)  matches rows whose labels array contains every listed label

labelsAny.description: Require any label (overlap)  matches rows whose labels array overlaps any listed label

query.description: Natural language query text to search for

limit.description: Maximum number of primary search results

includeNeighbors.description: Whether to include neighbors for each result

maxNeighbors.description: Maximum number of neighbors per result

maxDistance.description: Maximum vector distance for similarity (0.0-2.0, lower = more similar)

projectId.description: Project ID this policy applies to

objectType.description: Object type to apply policy to (e.g., "Document", "Requirement", "TestCase")

enabled.description: Whether embedding is enabled for this object type

maxPropertySize.description: Maximum property size in bytes. Objects with properties larger than this will not be embedded.

requiredLabels.description: Labels that must be present on the object for it to be embedded

excludedLabels.description: Labels that prevent embedding if present on the object

relevantPaths.description: JSON Pointer paths to relevant properties. If specified, only these paths will be embedded (field masking).

excludedStatuses.description: Status values that prevent embedding if present on the object

enabled.description: Whether embedding is enabled for this object type

maxPropertySize.description: Maximum property size in bytes. Objects with properties larger than this will not be embedded.

requiredLabels.description: Labels that must be present on the object for it to be embedded

excludedLabels.description: Labels that prevent embedding if present on the object

relevantPaths.description: JSON Pointer paths to relevant properties

execute.description: If true, attempt to apply the merge (will fail with 409 if any conflicts). When false or omitted, performs a dry-run only.

limit.description: Optional enumeration limit override (must be <= server max). Primarily for testing.

source_head_id.description: Head version id on source branch

target_head_id.description: Head version id on target branch

source_paths.description: Changed property paths on source since LCA

target_paths.description: Changed property paths on target since LCA (empty if no divergence)

conflicts.description: List of conflicting property paths (subset intersection of source/target paths with differing final values)

source_head_id.description: Head version id on source branch

target_head_id.description: Head version id on target branch

source_src_id.description: Source node id (src) on source head

source_dst_id.description: Destination node id (dst) on source head

target_src_id.description: Source node id (src) on target head

target_dst_id.description: Destination node id (dst) on target head

source_paths.description: Changed property paths on source since LCA

target_paths.description: Changed property paths on target since LCA (empty if no divergence)

conflicts.description: List of conflicting property paths (subset intersection of source/target paths with differing final values)

targetBranchId.description: Target branch the merge would apply to

dryRun.description: True if this response is only a dry-run (always true in MVP)

unchanged_count.description: Count of objects unchanged after merge (no action needed)

added_count.description: Count of objects newly added by source branch

fast_forward_count.description: Count of objects that can be applied without conflict (fast-forward or safe merge)

conflict_count.description: Count of objects with conflicts requiring manual resolution

truncated.description: Set when enumeration truncated due to limit cap

hard_limit.description: Server enforced hard limit (for client visibility)

applied.description: True when merge changes were applied (execute=true & no conflicts)

applied_objects.description: Number of objects mutated/created during apply (added + fast_forward)

relationships_unchanged_count.description: Count of relationships unchanged after merge (no action needed)

relationships_added_count.description: Count of relationships newly added by source branch

relationships_fast_forward_count.description: Count of relationships that can be applied without conflict (fast-forward or safe merge)

relationships_conflict_count.description: Count of relationships with conflicts requiring manual resolution

objectIds.description: Array of object IDs to generate embeddings for

priority.description: Priority for embedding jobs (higher = processed first)

skipped.description: Number of jobs that were already pending/processing

jobIds.description: Array of job IDs that were created or found

projectId.description: Project ID to regenerate embeddings for

objectType.description: Object type filter (if specified, only regenerate embeddings for this type)

priority.description: Priority for embedding jobs (higher = processed first)

force.description: Force regeneration even if embedding already exists

suggestionIndex.description: Index of the suggestion within the message
Index of the suggestion within the message

until.description: ISO 8601 datetime string for snooze until time

direction.description: Pagination direction relative to cursor (forward = items after cursor, backward = items before cursor). Only meaningful when cursor is supplied.

span.example: Decision depends on consistent flag rollout

limit.description: Effective page size after server cap

requested_limit.description: Original client requested limit before clamping

direction.description: Pagination direction used for this page.

total_estimate.description: Total size of fused candidate pool prior to pagination (may be less than lexical_considered+vector_considered due to overlaps).

approx_position_start.description: Approximate 1-based index of first item in this page relative to fused pool snapshot. 0 if page empty.

approx_position_end.description: Approximate 1-based index of last item in this page relative to fused pool snapshot. 0 if page empty.

enabled.description: Whether to include relationships for graph results

maxNeighbors.description: Maximum number of neighbors per graph result

limit.description: Maximum total number of results to return

fusionStrategy.description: Strategy for combining/fusing graph and text results

weights.description: Weights for combining graph and text scores

relationshipOptions.description: Options for expanding relationships in graph results

includeDebug.description: Whether to include debug metadata in response

maxTokenBudget.description: Maximum token budget for field truncation (applies to graph results)

totalResults.description: Total number of results across both types

debug.description: Debug information (only included with search:debug scope)

updated_at.description: ISO timestamp of last schema update

projects.description: Projects within organization that user has access to

title.description: Optional initial title for the conversation

projectId.description: Optional project ID to associate with the conversation

id.description: The newly created conversation ID (UUID format)

tools.description: Array of tool definitions with metadata

messages.description: Array of messages in the conversation

conversationId.description: Optional conversation ID to continue existing conversation

projectId.description: Optional project ID for scoped knowledge base search

enabledTools.description: Array of enabled tool names. If null, all tools are enabled (default). If empty array, no tools are enabled.

url.description: URL of the external source to import

syncIntervalMinutes.description: Sync interval in minutes (for periodic sync policy)

immediate.description: Process immediately (true) or queue for background processing (false)

metadata.description: Custom metadata to attach to the external source

documentCount.description: Number of documents from this source

force.description: Force re-fetch even if no changes detected

syncIntervalMinutes.description: Sync interval in minutes (for periodic sync policy)

resourceId.description: UUID of the document or graph object

resourceName.description: Display name of the resource (filename or object name)

resourceSubtype.description: Additional type info: MIME type for documents, object type for objects
Additional type info (MIME type or object type)

accessedAt.description: When the resource was last accessed

timestamp.description: ISO timestamp when log was created

url.description: Browser URL where log was captured

logs.description: Array of log entries from browser

objectId.description: Object ID this conversation is for

updatedAt.description: When the conversation was last updated

messageCount.description: Number of messages in the conversation

content.description: The message content from the user

messageId.description: The message ID containing the suggestion

suggestionIndex.description: Index of the suggestion in the message

expectedVersion.description: Current object version for optimistic locking

success.description: Whether the suggestion was successfully applied

messageId.description: The message ID containing the suggestion

suggestionIndex.description: Index of the suggestion in the message

userId.description: User ID who sent the message (for user messages)

suggestions.description: Suggestions in this message (for assistant messages)

releaseEmailsEnabled.description: Whether user receives release notification emails

email.description: Email address associated with this token
